Text:
This is the first talking performance by Charlie Chaplin.  He later commented that if he knew the full extent of the war atrocities, he never would have made the film.  

Fortunately for us, he did.

-DogNo7

I neglected the IMDB entry, which I normally link to, my apologies.

I should have also mentioned, this is Xvid encoded, with AC3 audio in an AVI envelope.

If you watch past the end of the movie, you will be treated to warnings of hellfire and dire agony.  It is an interesting contrast to the last speech given in the film.

Chaplin would have despised and loathed the MPAA, and all of the constipated pontifications that men of mediocrity are trying to force us to live under, in the name of "Globalization".

Unfortunately, or fortunately, depending on how you look at it, Charles Chaplin never lived to see the current world, or he would have realized that national boundaries and national sovereignty are the only means free men have for a chance for liberty.

Heil Hinkel.

-DogNo7

This is fantastic film!
First ever i saw of Chaplin and its really good, screw all this new shit when there's great films from the 1940 :D
There is one movie by Chaplin thats named The Gold Rush. I think that Charles did a better work in that movie. Still... Love this movie.  :)

Excellent quality, great movie!

Thanks for the upload.
